title: 108_s2046
content: Everglades National Park. The Everglades National Park Protection and Expansion Act of 1989 is amended to allow the Secretary to acquire up to 10 acres of land for park development purposes outside the park boundary near the East Everglades area. The Everglades National Park Protection and Expansion Act of 1989 is amended to allow the Secretary to acquire land for park development purposes outside the park boundary near the East Everglades area. The acquired land shall be administered as part of the park in accordance with applicable laws. Additionally, the amendment includes definitions for terms such as Administrator, County, and County land. The Everglades National Park Protection and Expansion Act of 1989 is amended to allow the Secretary to acquire land for park development purposes outside the park boundary near the East Everglades area. The acquired land shall be administered as part of the park in accordance with applicable laws. Definitions for terms such as Administrator, County, and County land are included in the amendment. Tract 605-01 and Tract 605-03 are defined, along with terms like District, District land, General Services Administration land, and map. The Boundary Modification for C-111 Project in Everglades National Park involves the exchange of National Park Service land, General Services Administration land, and County land. The amendment allows the Secretary to acquire land for park development purposes outside the park boundary near the East Everglades area. The Secretary will convey National Park Service land to the District for the C-111 project, including Everglades restoration. The park boundary will be adjusted after the land exchange. The National Park Service will exchange land with the District for the C-111 project, including Everglades restoration. A map of the land exchange will be available for public inspection. The amendment to Public Law 93-440 authorizes the exchange of certain land in Everglades National Park.
